From Foundation 6.4, flex is enabled by default and **only the new XY Grid is availaible**. However, others CSS versions are availaible for backward compatibility and the most common usage cases. For others uses and advanced customization, we recommand to build Foundation with custom settings (see others installation methods).

If you aren't into Sass, we have a starter template with compiled CSS and JavaScript, as well as a starting `index.html` file for you to hack on. Just unzip and get coding!

Recommended for beginners
After you selected "Foundation for Sites", Foundation CLI will ask you which template you want to use. You can choose between:
Then use to create a new Foundation project:
Depending on how your machine is configured, the command may fail with an `EACCESS` error. To get around this, run the commands with `sudo` at the beginning.
Not a fan of GUIs? The Node-powered Foundation CLI can install the same template projects for you.
Concatenated JavaScript files.
Compiled CSS files. Includes minified and unminified files.
Source JavaScript files. If you're using a build system, make sure `foundation.core.js` is loaded first.
Source Sass files. Use this folder as a load path in Sass.

Foundation is available on npm, Bower, Meteor, and Composer. The package includes all of the source Sass and JavaScript files, as well as compiled CSS and JavaScript, in uncompressed and compressed flavors.
There are many ways to install Foundation, but if you're just getting started, we have a few suggestions.
See how people are using Foundation to build responsive, future-friendly sites. We learn what went into their designs, decisions, and how Foundation helped them get to their goals.

Foundation in the wild. See how people are using Foundation to build responsive, future-friendly sites. We learn what went into their designs, decisions, and how Foundation helped them get to their goals.
Foundation Case Studies
Big brands are relying more and more on the world's most advanced, responsive front-end framework. Their sites are now built so that customers can connect with them on any device.
Foundation Brands
5 Years of Shaping the Web
Learn more about the framework and where it's going next.

This year Foundation turned five years old. It was the first to be responsive, the first to be semantic, the first to be mobile first, the first to be built with Sass, and the first to have accessibility built in. Learn more about the framework and where it's going next.
This is a demo integration of Foundation for Sites 6.3 in a VueJS 2.1 single-page application.
Setting up Vue 2 and Foundation 6
JointsWP is a blank WordPress theme built with Foundation 6, giving you all the power and flexibility you need to build complex, mobile friendly websites without starting from scratch.
JointsWP: Foundation 6 meets WordPress
React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. Now you can use Foundation for Sites 6 components implemented in React with CSS Modules!

The awesome folks at Pinecone created an Angular port for Foundation. Angular.js assists with creating single-page applications, one-page web applications that only require HTML, CSS, and JavaScript on the client side.
Angular Foundation 6
